rComments: This professor is amazing. I'm not a poli sci major but someone who took it to fulfill a minor and he makes learning easy. Go to lectures because he outlines course material very well and at a pace that's easy to copy down notes. He'll repeat important topics and terms that you'll need on the exam and he's very approachable

Make sure to go to lectures! His powerpoints don't carry even close to the amount of detail he covers in class. That being said, he is a great prof, enthusiastic about what he is teaching and very good at breaking down information.
Pretty good professor who knows how to teach. Make sure you attend his lectures and take good notes, because that's what he mainly tests on. Easy to get above an 80 in his class if you work hard.
had him for climate change politics but is a tad bit boring but really nice guy
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Very egotistical
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Participation matters', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Amazing prof! Easiest 4.0, just go to lecture and take good notes. He made the final exam really easy and straightforward
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'So many papers', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Remember to attend lectures and do all your journals, this will help you to success in his lecture.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'EXTRA CREDIT', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: awesome professor

Not a bad prof. Seems to be overrated by some. His Powerpoint slides are kinda useless so it's really recommended that you attend lectures, pay attention, and take good notes. If you miss a class, make sure you get notes from someone or you're screwed for that week. Makes the content of the course easy to understand.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Easiest bird courses i've ever taken! Easy 4.0!

Fantastic lecturer. Take very good lecture notes and you will do well. Decent amt of reading but after finishing course I can say that you should only take broad ideas from reading and do not worry about the little details. Try to take out information that can be related to lectures. Start essay early as it is somewhat difficult. Funny prof as well

Amazing lecturer! Even though it was on climate change and was a full two hour lecture, I was never bored and was always engaged in what he was talking about. Exam was a piece of cake! Making a lot of lecture notes and actually listening in lecture helped a lot in doing well on the exam.
teacherRatingTags: ['So many papers', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Hoffmann? more like Hoff-Myself.

Hoffmann is passionate and intensely knowledgeable about the politics of climate change. He is a good professor, if a dry one. His voice is monotone but sarcastically funny on occasion. If you like the subject, you'll like him. He also looks like he could be a wonderful opera singer, if that's any help!
Overall, Prof Hoffmann is a pretty good teacher. He knows his stuff but his class is so boring. Climate change is not a topic I can listen to for 12 weeks.

My favourite professor I have ever taken. I plan on taking as many classes with him as I can whether I'm interested in the topics or not. He inspired me so much and because of him I now have a passion for climate politics. Amazing lecturer- the time goes by quickly because you're so into what he's saying. Highly recommend. Easy exams
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Amazing lectures']

rComments: Tutorials suck but the class is great! MCQs are hard on tests, lots of reading,but its interesting

Must attend Profesor Hoffmans lectures in order to do well. His lectures are very clear, concise straight to the point, interesting. Readings are essential to passing two articles per week and a few web links. He knows his stuff and also has good humor. Overall interesting course midterm and final fair, multiple choice however tricky.
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures', 'Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Course: The New International Agenda  Professor Hoffmann is clear and presents concepts very clearly. His course is so interesting and relevant to current global issues that you can't stop talking about it (even outside of class). Overall great learning experience. Not easy though!
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Participation matters', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Professor Hoffman is always well prepared and organized for class.  He keeps each topic interesting and the class engaged.
Great prof! Always enthusiastic and passionate about what he does. Super organized with good slides. Would definitely recommend

Very nice & approachable. Demonstrates interest in material. Intent on making sure students understand material. Tries to make lec enjoyable. Thoroughly enjoyed his class. 1 of the better profs @ UTSC.
Professor Hoffmann makes the subject sound so interesting ^^
He was a really great Prof. One of the best. He made the class interesting.

Proffessour Hoffmann is the best university teacher I have thus had. Everyone should take his courses POLB80 and POLB81, he's interesting, knowledgable and makes the course so interesting. Congratulations proffessour Hoffmann for being one of the best teachers at UTSC. I wish you taught more classes!
Very handsome professor! very organized.
Very good prof.. is very clear and makes the course lectures very interesting, wish i had him last sem, much better than teiku
VERY HANDSOME PROF. AND VERY INTERESTING!!

very clear and understandable, keeps class interesting and alive with humor here and there...learned alot from him, made even history easy to understand...overall great experince learning..cant wait for polb81 myself...

Professor Hoffman is a great professor. He made international theories interesting.  I know more about the United Nations than i did in my 4 years of university.  He shows a high level of interest in his profession which makes students happy to attend the lectures.  Excellent semester, can't wait till POLB81.
